Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

(2) Summary

A lot is being written about API products and how API management should become less focused on pure technology and more on a product perspective for APIs. Is that true for all APIs? And if not, how do you decide how to manage a specific API? In this session, we'll look at how to determine which APIs can benefit most when being managed as products and how API lifecycle management changes when you take a product perspective.

Based on Business Vision Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

(4) Integration vs. Composability

  • APIs can be used for 1:1 interconnections
    • Componentization often is one of the goals of modern software architecture
    • All communication between components is API based
    • Connecting components for a single purpose is using a project mindset
  • APIs can be used for 1:n interconnections
    • Changeability and flexibility are goals of modern business architecture
    • Value chains must adapt to changing needs and new competition
    • Designing components for reuse is using a product mindset


Based on Business Vision Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

(7) What is a Product?



Product Mindset Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

(8) What is a Good API (Product)?

  1. It's well-designed
  2. It's designed with consumers in mind
  3. It's designed to be used by many consumers
  4. It's following a product lifecycle
  5. It's easily findable and consumable
  6. It's marketed with the target audience in mind


Product Mindset Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

Focus on API Consumption Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

(13) Products Need Marketing

  • Traditional 1:1 integration creates one solution for each problem
  • API 1:n composability creates a product intended for a market
  • Products drive value only when they are being consumed
  • The main drivers for your business are excellent API product candidates
    • Ordering should be open so that partners or 3rd party apps can create orders
    • Delivery should be flexible so that new delivery options are easy to add
    • Invoicing should be flexible so that new payment methods are easy to add


Focus on API Consumption Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management

(18) API Product Management

  1. Focus on APIs well-aligned with business strategy and goals
  2. Design APIs as products with a lifecycle in mind
  3. Invest in marketing to get most out of your products


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): A Product Perspective on API Lifecycle Management
